285: Prime Healthcare is an award-winning health system headquartered in Ontario, California. Prime Healthcare operates 45 hospitals and has more than 300 outpatient locations in 14 states providing more than 2.6 million patient visits annually. It is one of the nation's leading health systems with nearly 50,000 employees and physicians. Fourteen of the Prime Healthcare hospitals are members of the Prime Healthcare Foundation, a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit public charity. Prime Healthcare is actively seeking new members to join our corporate team!The Payroll Analyst will be responsible for performing a wide variety of payroll activities, including ensuring accuracy and compliance of proper internal control payroll processes. The job involves conducting root cause analysis to identify payroll systems problems/issues. Responsible in maintaining payroll systems audit monthly, quarterly or as required. The job may also assist with external payroll audit request, implementations of current or new acquisitions, researching laws and regulations regarding taxes and payroll procedures as needed.#LI-LA1#LI-VR2Required qualifications:+ High school diploma.+ A minimum of 5years Hospital Payroll experience.+ General accounting background.+ Hands-on experience with Excel or equivalent.+ Experience with JBDev/Kronos or similar timekeeping system.+ Some knowledge of ADP preferred.+ Knowledge of Wage and Hour Guidelines and Healthcare pay practices.+ Knowledge of payroll dictionary set up.+ Hands on experience with payroll taxes.Preferred qualifications:+ Hands on experience with audits for 401k, DOL, W/C preferred+ Multi-state knowledge of payroll laws preferred.+ Some knowledge of ADP preferred.+ Experience with union collective bargaining agreements and protocols preferred.Prime Healthcare Management Inc., offers competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that provides employees the flexibility to tailor benefits according to their individual needs. Our Total Rewards package includes, but is not limited to, paid time off, a 401K retirement plan, medical, dental, and vision coverage, tuition reimbursement, and many more voluntary benefit options. A reasonable compensation estimate for this role, which includes estimated wages, benefits, and other forms of compensation, is $24.68 to $38.00. The exact starting compensation to be offered will be determined at the time of selecting an applicant for hire, in which a wide range of factors will be considered, including but not limited to, skillset, years of applicable experience, education, credentials and licensure.We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to veteran status, disability, race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or other protected characteristics.
